overview:
Vince Cushing has 40 years of experience encompassing all facets of the electricity businessâ€”power contracting, grid operations and economics, generation environmental compliance, commercial building demand response, strategic planning, retail power supply planning and financial risk management. Throughout his career, he has served as an engineer, manager, consultant and executive. In addition to Clean Urban Energy, Inc., he has co-founded two demand response service companies, Metropolitan Energy, LLC and EnergyConnect, Inc., which engage large urban commercial buildings in regional electric grid operations and markets.

Mr. Cushing has served on the Operating Committee of the North American Electric Reliability Council, on executive committees of regional power pools and reliability coordinating councils, as Chairman of the Interconnection Arrangements Committee of the Edison Electric Institute and as a utility industry liaison to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. He earned his bachelorâ€™s in electrical engineering from the University of Notre Dame and a masterâ€™s in engineering administration from George Washington University.
